content.title: Matrimonial Incentives
content.department: Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance
content.details: The Matrimonial Incentives scheme provides financial assistance to couples where either the husband or the wife is disabled, aimed at promoting marriage among disabled individuals.
benefits: Allowance of ₹500/- to attend the marriage incentive program
eligibility: Either the husband or the wife must be disabled
Percentage of disability should be 40% and above
Permanent residents of the state of Maharashtra
exclusions: Individuals already availing benefits of this scheme cannot reapply
Applicants from neighboring states are not eligible
content.application_process: The application process is entirely free of cost and requires submission of mandatory documents.
documents_required: Residential Certificate / Domicile Certificate of the State of Maharashtra

faqs.question: Is It Mandatory For Both The Husband And The Wife To Be Disabled?
faqs.answer: No, either the husband or the wife should be disabled in order to be eligible for the matrimonial incentive.

faqs.question: What Should Be The Percentage Of The Disability?
faqs.answer: The percentage of disability should be 40% and above.

faqs.question: What Percentage Of The Financial Assistance Will Be In The Form Of Household Utility?
faqs.answer: The amount of ₹ 4,500/- will be in the form of household utility.

faqs.question: Will There Be Any Allowance Provided To Attend The Marriage Incentive Program?
faqs.answer: Yes, ₹ 500/- will be provided to attend the marriage incentive program.

faqs.question: What Percentage Of The Financial Assistance Will Be Provided As Cash?
faqs.answer: ₹ 20,000/- will be provided as cash.

faqs.question: Why Is Proof Of Age A Mandatory Document For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Proof of age is required to confirm that the husband and wife are of legal marriage age.

faqs.question: Is The Entire Amount Of The Financial Assistance Provided As Cash?
faqs.answer: No, only ₹ 20,000/- is provided as cash, the rest of the amount is provided as savings certificate, household utility, etc.

faqs.question: What Is The Maximum Amount Of Financial Assistance That One Can Receive Through This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The maximum amount of financial assistance that one can receive through this scheme is ₹ 50,000/-.

faqs.question: Are There Any Eligibility Criteria Regarding The Percentage Of Disability Of The Applicant?
faqs.answer: Yes, the percentage of disability of the applicant should be 40% and above.

faqs.question: Are Orthopedically Handicapped Persons Also Covered In This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme also covers Orthopedically Handicapped Persons.

faqs.question: Is The Residential Certificate / Domicile Certificate Of The State Of Maharashtra, A Mandatory Document For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Residential Certificate / Domicile Certificate of the State of Maharashtra is a mandatory document for this scheme.

faqs.question: Can I Reapply To This Scheme If I Am Already Availing The Benefits Of This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, you can not reapply to this scheme if you already have availed of its benefits.

faqs.question: What Is The Full Form Of SJSA?
faqs.answer: The full form of SJSA is 'Social Justice & Special Assistance'.

faqs.question: Is This A State Funded Or A Centrally Funded Scheme?
faqs.answer: This is a 100% State Funded scheme.

faqs.question: Is There Any Application Fee?
faqs.answer: No, the entire application process is entirely free of cost.

faqs.question: Is There Any Compensation For The Delay In The Disbursal Of The Scheme Benefits?
faqs.answer: No, there is no such mention in the scheme guidelines.

faqs.question: How Do I Know If A Field In The Application Form Is Mandatory?
faqs.answer: The mandatory fields have an asterisk (*) mark at the end.

faqs.question: Can Applicants From The Neighboring States Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Telangana, Etc Also Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only the citizens who are permanent residents of the state of Maharashtra are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: Where Can I Find The URL To The Website Of The Dept. Of Social Justice & Special Assistance?
faqs.answer: The URL to the official website of the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Government of Maharashtra is - https://sjsa.maharashtra.gov.in/

faqs.question: Where Can I Find The Link To The Scheme Guidelines?
faqs.answer: The Scheme Guidelines can be found at this link - https://sjsa.maharashtra.gov.in/en/scheme-category/disability-welfare

faqs.question: What Is The Address Of The Department Of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Government Of Maharashtra?
faqs.answer: The address of the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Government of Maharashtra is: 437, Shankar Sheth Rd, Police Colony, Swargate, Pune, Maharashtra 411042.

faqs.question: Where Can I Find The Addresses Of The District Social Welfare Offices?
faqs.answer: The addresses of the District Social Welfare Offices can be found at - https://sjsa.maharashtra.gov.in/en/contacts

faqs.question: Where Can I Post My Grievances Related To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: You can post your grievances at the Grievance Redressal Portal by the Govt. of Maharashtra: https://grievances.maharashtra.gov.in/en

faqs.question: Is There An Income-Related Criterion For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no income-related criterion for this scheme.

faqs.question: Where Can I Find The Format Of The Application Form? Is It Available Online?
faqs.answer: You need to visit the District Social Welfare Office and request a hard copy of the format of the application form for the scheme from the concerned authority.
